ruleset.name: Naming
ruleset.description: The Naming Ruleset contains rules regarding preferred usage of names and identifiers.

rule.name: ShortVariable
rule.message: Avoid variables with short names like {0}
rule.description: Fields, local variables, or parameter names that are very short are not helpful to the reader.

property.name: minimum
property.description: Number of characters that are required as a minimum for a variable name.

rule.name: LongVariable
rule.message: Avoid excessively long variable names like {0}
rule.description: Fields, formal arguments, or local variable names that are too long can make the code difficult to follow.

rule.name: ShortMethodName
rule.message: Avoid using short method names
rule.description: Method names that are very short are not helpful to the reader.

property.name: minimum
property.description: Number of characters that are required as a minimum for a method name.

rule.name: VariableNamingConventions
rule.message: {0} variable {1} should begin with {2}
rule.description: A variable naming conventions rule - customize this to your liking. Currently, it checks for final variables that should be fully capitalized and non-final variables that should not include underscores.

rule.name: MethodNamingConventions
rule.message: Method name does not begin with a lower case character.
rule.description: Method names should always begin with a lower case character, and should not contain underscores.

rule.name: ClassNamingConventions
rule.message: Class names should begin with an uppercase character
rule.description: Class names should always begin with an upper case character.
rule.example: public class Foo {}

rule.name: AbstractNaming
rule.message: Abstract classes should be named 'AbstractXXX'
rule.description: Abstract classes should be named 'AbstractXXX'.

property.name: strict
property.description: Also flag classes, that are named Abstract, but are not abstract.

rule.example: public abstract class Foo { // should be AbstractFoo }

rule.name: AvoidDollarSigns
rule.message: Avoid using dollar signs in variable/method/class/interface names
rule.description: Avoid using dollar signs in variable/method/class/interface names.
rule.example: public class Fo$o { // not a recommended name }

rule.name: MethodWithSameNameAsEnclosingClass
rule.message: Classes should not have non-constructor methods with the same name as the class
rule.description: Non-constructor methods should not have the same name as the enclosing class.

rule.name: SuspiciousHashcodeMethodName
rule.message: The method name and return type are suspiciously close to hashCode()
rule.description: The method name and return type are suspiciously close to hashCode(), which may denote an intention to override the hashCode() method.

rule.name: SuspiciousConstantFieldName
rule.message: The field name indicates a constant but its modifiers do not
rule.description: Field names using all uppercase characters - Sun's Java naming conventions indicating constants - should be declared as final.

rule.name: SuspiciousEqualsMethodName
rule.message: The method name and parameter number are suspiciously close to equals(Object)
rule.description: The method name and parameter number are suspiciously close to equals(Object), which can denote an intention to override the equals(Object) method.

property.name: xpath
property.value: //MethodDeclarator[@Image = 'equals'] [ (count(FormalParameters/*) = 1 and not (FormalParameters/FormalParameter/Type/ReferenceType/ClassOrInterfaceType [@Image = 'Object' or @Image = 'java.lang.Object']) or not (../ResultType/Type/PrimitiveType[@Image = 'boolean']) ) or ( count(FormalParameters/*) = 2 and ../ResultType/Type/PrimitiveType[@Image = 'boolean'] and FormalParameters//ClassOrInterfaceType[@Image = 'Object' or @Image = 'java.lang.Object'] and not(../../Annotation/MarkerAnnotation/Name[@Image='Override']) ) ] | //MethodDeclarator[@Image = 'equal'] [ count(FormalParameters/*) = 1 and FormalParameters/FormalParameter/Type/ReferenceType/ClassOrInterfaceType [@Image = 'Object' or @Image = 'java.lang.Object'] ]

rule.name: AvoidFieldNameMatchingTypeName
rule.message: It is somewhat confusing to have a field name matching the declaring class name
rule.description: It is somewhat confusing to have a field name matching the declaring class name. This probably means that type and/or field names should be chosen more carefully.

rule.name: AvoidFieldNameMatchingMethodName
rule.message: Field {0} has the same name as a method
rule.description: It can be confusing to have a field name with the same name as a method. While this is permitted, having information (field) and actions (method) is not clear naming. Developers versed in Smalltalk often prefer this approach as the methods denote accessor methods.

rule.name: NoPackage
rule.message: All classes and interfaces must belong to a named package
rule.description: Detects when a class or interface does not have a package definition.

rule.name: PackageCase
rule.message: Package name contains upper case characters
rule.description: Detects when a package definition contains uppercase characters.

rule.name: MisleadingVariableName
rule.message: Avoid naming non-fields with the prefix 'm_'
rule.description: Detects when a non-field has a name starting with 'm_'. This usually denotes a field and could be confusing.

rule.name: BooleanGetMethodName
rule.message: A 'getX()' method which returns a boolean should be named 'isX()'
rule.description: Methods that return boolean results should be named as predicate statements to denote this. I.e, 'isReady()', 'hasValues()', 'canCommit()', 'willFail()', etc. Avoid the use of the 'get' prefix for these methods.
rule.example: public boolean getFoo(); // bad public boolean isFoo(); // ok public boolean getFoo(boolean bar); // ok, unless checkParameterizedMethods=true

rule.name: ShortClassName
rule.message: Avoid short class names like {0}
rule.description: Short Classnames with fewer than e.g. five characters are not recommended.

property.name: minimum
property.description: Number of characters that are required as a minimum for a class name.

rule.example: public class Foo { }

rule.name: GenericsNaming
rule.message: Generics names should be a one letter long and upper case.
rule.description: Names for references to generic values should be limited to a single uppercase letter.
